Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: caCertificateFilePath
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: File name of CA certificate to be used.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: caCertificateDirPath
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Path to directory containing hashed CA’s to be used.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: certificateFilePath
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Path to the certificate file to be used.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: keyFilePath
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Path to the key file to be used.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: clientAllowsSelfSignedCertificates
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: True if isServer == false and the client accepts self-signed certificates. Defaults to false, be careful to not leave as true in production

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: useDefaultCiphers
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: True to use default cipher list, false otherwise.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: password
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Password (if needed) typically used for PKCS12 files.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: embeddedServerCertPaths
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: For clients that allow self-signed server certificates, verify against ones provided locally.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: init(withCipherSuite:clientAllowsSelfSignedCertificates:embeddedServerCertPaths:)
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Initialize a configuration with no backing certificates.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: init(withCACertificateFilePath:usingCertificateFile:withKeyFile:usingSelfSignedCerts:cipherSuite:)
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Initialize a configuration using a CA Certificate file.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: init(withCACertificateDirectory:usingCertificateFile:withKeyFile:usingSelfSignedCerts:cipherSuite:)
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Initialize a configuration using a CA Certificate directory.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.name: init(withChainFilePath:withPassword:usingSelfSignedCerts:clientAllowsSelfSignedCertificates:cipherSuite:)
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/s.abstract: Initialize a configuration using a Certificate Chain File.

Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/i.name: init(withPEMCertificateString:usingSelfSignedCerts:cipherSuite:)
Classes/SSLService/Configuration.html#/i.abstract: Initialize a configuration using a PEM formatted certificate in String form.

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: SSLReadWriteDispatcher
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: Used to dispatch reads and writes to protect the SSLContext

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: verifyCallback
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: Verification Callback. Called by the internal verifyConnection() function to do any additional connection verification. This property is set after initializing the SSLService.

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: skipVerification
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: If true, skips the internal verification. However, if the verifyCallback property is set, the callback will be called regardless of this setting. Default is false. This property is set after initializing the SSLService.

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: isServer
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: True if setup as server, false if setup as client.

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: socketPtr
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: Socket Pointer containing the socket fd (passed to the SSLRead and SSLWrite callback routines).

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: onAccept(socket:)
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: Processing on acceptance from a listening socket

Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.name: onConnect(socket:)
Classes/SSLService.html#/s:10SSLServiceA.abstract: Processing on connection to a listening socket

Classes/SSLService.html.name: SSLService
Classes/SSLService.html.abstract: SSLService:** SSL Service Plugin for Socket using Apple Secure Transport on macOS and OpenSSL on Linux.
